headline: Should Sherwin-Williams’ Dividend Hike, Suvinil Deal and New Lawsuit Require Action From SHW Investors?
summary: In February 2026, The Sherwin-Williams Company’s board approved a higher regular quarterly dividend of $0.80 per share, marking its 47th consecutive yearly increase, while the company also extended $75,000,000 of credit commitments and faced a new California labor-related class action lawsuit filed earlier that month. Alongside these developments, Sherwin-Williams’ completion of the Suvinil acquisition and decades-long pattern of dividend growth underline how management is pairing global...
